reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as have seen it on previous trips to Oxford but never had the joy to stay. As it was my 30th this year we booked to stay for one night on the Jubilee weekend.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing to say is that the service here is excellent: we had booked a car parking space (pricey at £20.00 but it entitles you to 24 hours parking so you can park up before your room is ready) and arrived at 12.45pm but our room was already available and the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful. The level of service from check-in lasted throughout our stay with every member of staff being attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic 'Babymoon'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a converted prison and we paid extra to stay in the main building as it has the original staircases and doors from its prison days. Our room was 117 on the ground/first floor so the view wasn't great, and anyone walking past could see the bed through the window, but the room itself was marvellous. The furnishings are cosy, the bed is huge and very comfortable and there is ample storage and facilities including flat screen TV, DVD player, and a bathroom with a free-standing bath and walk-in shower. Each room is converted from three cells so are spacious. The toiletries in the bathroom were also gorgeous and promptly went into our suitcase!
reviews.title: Unique place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have dinner at the hotel but visited the cocktail bar on the third floor. The view from there is very impressive and the furnishings are comfortable and contemporary. There is a huge selection of cocktails and other drinks on offer and it was the perfect start to our evening (we then had dinner at The Living Room which is on the driveway to the hotel - highly recommended).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room included breakfast which we went to have at about 9.30am (information in the room recommends avoiding the core time of 10-11am and we had no problem being seated and served). Again, the service was exceptional and the continental buffet selection is ample. We also ordered from the hot menu and I had the best waffles I have ever tasted (apologies for being so effusive but I LOVED that breakfast!). All of the food was cooked fresh to order and everything looked appetising.
reviews.title: Stylish and cool hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for only one night location is great very friendly staff. We had a great room inthe castle part of the hotel with views over the old courtyard. Will be staying here again next time we are in Oxford
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: The best hotel I've ever stayed in, Cell room was fab original cell door and windows yet a massive bed and mini bar. The staff were friendly and helpful check in and out was quick and hassle free - I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Amazing!!
Amazing Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in a Cell room (shower only) with my girlfriend. We were both very impressed with the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is excellent. Right in the centre of Oxford and close to shops/pubs/restaurants. We decided to park the car at the hotel which is £25 a night which is a bit of a rip off but convenient as staff will park your car in the underground car park and fetch it as required. The hotel is also very easy to find from the A34.
reviews.title: Quirky hotel, friendly staff, fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a cell room (shower only) and it was great. The room was below ground level and so was very dark and atmospheric (like in all the pictures). The room was a decent size and very nice. Bathroom was very modern and clean. Only slight issue would be the dodgy television as the signal wasn't great but we didn't really watch the TV much so it didn't matter.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience - but ....very hard bed !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Lovely night's stay on Sunday. Staff were friendly and efficient. The air con in our room was broken so the staff moved us to a better room, no questions asked, without hesitation or inconvenience. Comfortable and atmospheric, good breakfast, central location.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: A truly unique setting that retains the character of the buildings past whilst delivering effortless indulgence throughout. First class customer service that uphold the standard of this hotel. Not priced for the feint hearted, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to tour the other Malmaisons!
reviews.title: A must, for that something special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An utterly charming hotel; they have kept the spirit of a gaol whilst wrapping you in luxury. Very efficient staff who are friendly and charming at the same time. Well worth just wandering around once you have checked in, there are extraordinary crevices well worth poking your nose in. Don't miss a drink in the visitors bar, expensive but oozing character. We had room 101 and fortunately not a rat to be seen, the only fault being a faulty sink plug. It's not cheap but worth eery penny and check out their website for deals.
reviews.title: Well worth being locked up here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Spent a weekend here in May 2012. Had previously stayed here and was a bit underwhelmed having been put in the modern annex building rather than the main cell rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, top service, bags of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time we had a cell and it made a world of difference. The room was lovely, with lots of character and nice little touches. The cell/prison theme is played on but quite subtly and not in a gimmicky way. Decor and design all excellent.
reviews.title: The only jail to want to stay in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice and beautiful place. I've organise it as a birthday surprise for my fiancee. Staff really helpfull. Interesting idea for use of old prison. Had a really good time.
reviews.title: Butiful !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They should change taxi drivers. Really rude and expensive.We've walk to the station.
reviews.title: A Cell with a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at the Malmaison Hotel in Reading ( the only redeeming feature of this dreary town), we tried the same chain in Oxford having seen it on the 'professional Geordie' episode of 'Lewis'.Retaining the cell doors, the painted brick walls and the prison walkways is so appropriate that I would not have been entirely surprised to see Noel Coward descending the walkway stairs, as in the scene from the original film 'The Italian Job'.The room, three cells, was spacious, comfortable and provided everything one could need for a weekend stay. The bathroom was equally spacious, modern and very clean with lovely big towels. Decor is, as always, dark- the Malmaison signature- but stylish. I would have preferred the lighting to be a little brighter but this is common to most hotels. There was a 'knees up' on Monday night so we could hear a thudding noise but this was turned down after eleven so did not disturb our night's sleep. Perhaps the management have taken note of Jo D's criticism. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as both of us felt that just a touch under £14 was too big a hit for cereal and toast which is all either of us wants for breakfast. Fine if you want to eat a large cooked breakfast but we don't. The staff were very polite and pleasant on our arrival and departure but otherwise we didn't need to trouble them.
reviews.title: Please, lock me up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great Mal in an old prison. Wonderful experience staying in converted cells. It also delivers on the Mal concept - tongue in cheek, nice design, good food, wonderful wine. Great to stay there and explore Oxford. One of the better hotels in the chain.
reviews.title: Very very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived 1-30 pm parking attendant very helpful, checkin after waiting a long time we are told
reviews.title: Supper at the old gaol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011. We had booked the cell room for 2 nights and we were not disappointed. We paid £20.00 per night for valet parking, which is a bit steep, but very convenient as the cars are parked right outside the castle entrance. The nearest public car park is not too far away, but not worth the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Birthday treat in a fabulous, unique and stunning hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel has 2 stunning bars and all the reception areas are dark and dimly lit in keeping with the theme. The furniture and decor is very interesting, as is the reoccurring picture which is always watching, everywhere you go! It can be quite disturbing. In fact, we took down the one in our room and turned it around!
reviews.title: Unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we checked in and were shown to our cell. The size of the cell was ok, not extremely spacious, but not too small - average. The bathroom was large and fully equipped with all the standard, high quality Mal toiletries.
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a couple of issues with our room, however. First, the windows did not open and although the room was air conditioned, some fresh air would have been nice. Second, the air conditioning in our room was faulty and had a leak!! This damaged some of our shoes and we raised the issue with the manager. We were offered complimentary drinks and another room, but we declined as this would not have been another cell room. Third, the room was very dark in the evening and although this was good as it was in keeping with the cell theme, it would have been nice to have the option to be able to see the clothes we had just bought and how we looked before going out. We rang down to reception and they brought us up some extra lamps which was helpful but was still fairly dark. However, these were small issues compared to the luxury and service that the hotel offered overall.
reviews.title: Wouldn't return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely as you could choose from the cooked menu to be made fresh and you had the option of the continental buffet. They offer complimentary WiFi use throughout the hotel and there is even a Krispy Kreme shop on site!! Mmmm. This is a great place to stay and you can occasionally get offers in the In Oxford magazine. There is lots to do including a tour of the castle and a leisurely, relaxing trip on a canal boat not far from the hotel. There are plenty of bars and restaurant within walking distance of the hotel as well as other attractions such as the courts, university and ghost tours. We ate at the 5500 Indian Restaurant which is worth booking if you are there at the weekend as it's very popular and rightly so.
reviews.title: Quirky short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not stay in the prison rooms themselves as were fully booked. However, our room was modern and comfortable. The grounds were interesting and the food in the restaurant was very good and worth the money. Friendly reception staff. Bar was relaxing and well decorated-staff a little cold.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Malmaison Oxford Castle is an absolutely stunning building in a great location surrounded by bars & restaurants, and a short walk from all the historic parts of Oxford, so ideal for a short break. We took advantage of the current 'stay sunday & get your room & meal for £100 offer' but I actually upgraded to a superior room in one of the cells for an extra few pounds as it was our 5th anniversary. The room was impressive & atmospheric, with lovely furnishings & a gorgeous bathroom - so that's all the positives! Just a few negatives to note - if you read other reviews you will see they mention the hard beds - well, I love a firm bed so this didn't put me off at all, but I have to say it was the hardest bed I've ever slept on & not very comfortable! Secondly, the food in the brasserie was very average indeed - my burger really didn't taste of much & my partner's gnocci consisted of 12 pieces arranged on a plate which looked pretty sorry for themselves - and at a £1 a piece it was a little disappointing. Also, the service was not very attentive - we had to ask for menus for each course & for drinks - we weren't in a hurry though so not too much of a problem. My final negative is quite a big one - and also mentioned in a lot of these reviews - the heating in the rooms was on far too high, and we were unable to adjust it or switch it off (there is a decoy thermostat which does nothing!!) & you can't open the windows. It was stifling - even though it was January it reminded me of trying to sleep on holiday in Greece. Because of this I have to say I wouldn't stay again - and I certainly wouldn't have paid the £200 rrp for the room. If you can get a cheap deal it's probably worth a try as the rooms are so nice, but otherwise I'd give it a miss unless they sort the heating out!
reviews.title: If you can get a good offer it's worth it, otherwise probably not!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extortionate prices for the poor service offered. The staff were rude and stuck up, I'd never go back. I was so disappointed having been to the Leeds malmaison last year and loving it, so didn't mind paying at all. Oxford was disappointing on so many levels. The room was small and there was a huge mess up with the bill in the brasserie, so that it ruined the night. But more importantly the staff, not the waitresses but the senior staff including the manager, were appalling.
reviews.title: Waste of money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I found this hotel very expensive and not value for money. On the plus side, nice modern decor and the room was well furnished, clean and comfortable - nice bathroom too. Good central location. On the negative side - asked for early check in which they couldn't give me so had to wait hours for room to be ready. Room service was expensive. My room was next to the main door of the corridor so it was quite noisy, every time someone came through the door it made my room door bang slightly! The hotel door man downstairs was snooty. Watched me struggle with my case towards the hotel door and then he went through it himself and didn't even hold the door open for me! Unless I was lucky enough to get a special offer deal, I wouldn't bother paying the hefty price for this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good central location, nice enough but very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having previously been to the Hotel on Business, we decided to take advantage of the special Sunday night offer (spend £75 per couple in the Restaurant and have a Double room for £25). We checked into our room in the main part of the Hotel which was a converted prison cell (the whole concept of this Hotel is brilliant), had a stroll then changed to go to the pre-booked Restaurant in the Hotel.......This is when it all went wrong!!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel.......Very Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here recently in a duplex suite, just overnight. The hotel is quite a novelty – once inside the main area you can see all the old prison wings and cells that have been converted.
reviews.title: Spooky and Rock Hard Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: We had dinner, which was just about okay, the order of service was a bit mixed up, the starters arrived quickly, the bread just a bit after, then a long wait for the main course. Desserts were fine. The music playing in the restaurant was a bit odd, some sort of garage CD, not really suitable at all.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed in the room was probably the worst bed I have ever slept in. The mattress was rock hard, and the quilt was not soft, like it had been washed without any conditioner.
reviews.title: Met the high expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: The fire alarm went off at 1am, and every few hours the tap in the bathroom would run for a few seconds. So all in all not a good night’s sleep at all.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had breakfast, which was fine.
reviews.title: Naughty but nice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stay here as a competition prize, in the Thomas Lowton Robins Suite. Wow, it was fantastic! From our private cinema room, to the roll top bath and the huge bed, it was a first class experience all the way. And that includes breakfast too. We've never stayed in a Malmaison before, but we definitely would again. The whole hotel exudes bags of character, without any attitude. The location is great too, with loads of restaurants, bars and shops all within a minute's walk. Just one thing, take your own DVDs for the cinema room as their collection isn't massive and won't suit everyone's tastes.
reviews.title: Top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a 30th birthday surprise from my husband. I had seen the hotel in a magazine a while ago and he had remembered and surprised me with a night away in January 2013.
reviews.title: A hotel with a difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and after trying to find a parking space that was cheaper than £3.90 an hour we decided to pay the £25 to park at the hotel. We were able to check into our room early which was a cell superior double. We stayed in room 121 which is in A wing which are the original cell blocks and was the equivalent of three cells. Two of the cells were the bedroom and one of the cells was the bathroom.
reviews.title: Oh dear! Does anyone have a torch?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom consisted of a good size bed, dressing tables, a desk, a wardrobe, a chair and tv and DVD. Everything else we needed was also found inside the wardrobe including an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, electronic safe, and fridge. There was also free wifi in the room which you just need to connect to (and if you do it properly it is very quick).
reviews.title: Unusual hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: In the bathroom there was a large separate shower and a roll top bath.
reviews.title: Enjoyable birthday celebration in quirky character hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have been recommending this hotel to all my friends and family because of the wonderful service of the receptionist that we spoke to on both days of our stay. Nothing was too much for her and she was so friendly. The hotel was atmospheric and unusual - we stayed in one of the cells. My friend and I booked the "Sunday Supplement" deal for a girlie shopping trip and paid a bit extra for the cell room, well worth it. Drove to the Park and Ride at Thornhill and caught the bus in for about £2.00 return, dropped us right outside the hotel and we were a very short walk away from the shops. Dined in the Restaurant, couldn't fault the food and the waiter was friendly enough - wouldn't want anymore attention that we received. Yes the hotel is dark but that is the charm of the place, it is an old building but all the facilities are modern and we slept very well in a beautiful bedroom. We will be going again with our respective partners, I'm sure. If you want to visit Oxford and it is a lovely city, stay at the Malmaison.
reviews.title: Fantastic Short Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated in the refurbished Oxford Prison, which makes this a very unusual hotel. We arrived early, and our rooms wern't ready - but the helpful reception team looked after our luggage and parked our car in the underground (valet parking) car park. After a relaxing day visiting the tourist sites of Oxford, we returned to the hotel, to find that there had been a power failue, resulting in no hot water. Our room was of typical Mal high standards and great trendy design (three cells had been knocked together to create a bedroom)! Dinner, was OK - the quality of food and service was fine. Nice breakfast. Well presented and good quality.
reviews.title: Unique hotel, great location, a quality Mal product

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, great visit, and would return.
reviews.title: Interesting setting and wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for a short break and were very impressed. This is a converted jail (HMP Slade in the BBC series "Porridge") Rooms are two cells knocked into one with 1/2 cell for the en suite. Even the original battered doors remain and the entire hotel has been upgraded to the typical high standards one associates with the Malamaison Group.
reviews.title: dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One important tip reserve a parking space. Although its £20 its well worth it
reviews.title: Nice cells, but service and restaurant let it down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in a suite for our 10th wedding anniversary and the whole experience was shocking. As we arrived my wife went to the ladies in reception which was an absolute disgrace, we then had to wait 25 minutes at reception to check in. We asked where we could have some lunch and were told that the kitchen is closing but if we hurry they would serve us, so we eat before we saw our room. We both commented how limited the menu was, we had a waiter who didn't bother writing down our order and got it completely wrong, the duck salad was swimming in oil. When we went to the room our impression was that it was OK but certainly no WOW factor. On further inspection it was dirty, we found clothes from previous guests and stains on the duvet and bed spread. We went to the bar for drinks before dinner and waited an age for them. However the most disappointing part of the evening was that the dinner menu was the same as the limited lunch menu. All 3 courses were wrong or cold bar the wine it was a disaster. The following morning for breakfast we were being served by a waiter that had worked the night before and had an attitude.
reviews.title: Shocking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be fair the management were extremely apologetic and comped the whole night. They explained that we had just caught them at a bad moment and our experience is not the norm. We have been invited back but on this occasion I can only review what we experienced.
reviews.title: Must do - Bed could be improved though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were eally impressed with the location an easy walk from the main railway station and easy to get about and walk around the town. We were a little early for check in so they held our bags and we went touring, but stopped in to visit the one original cell they had kept and advised us to go and check out before heading out and about. There is a Marks and Spencer near by for grocery top ups and a few pubs, although we didn't venture into those. The bed was probably a bit too firm, and I usually like a firm bed. The renovations were pretty modern, although were slightly beginning to show wear and tear. The room was spacious and generally a good stay. Overall, I would do it all over again, as it was definitely one of those must do things.
reviews.title: What a Wow Factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely hotel; Staff were excellent, check in was efficient, my previous call to confirm a couple of details and to pay upfront for room and car park was expertly processed. On arrival, the car was taken care of and although the room wasn't ready, we were checked in and luggage was stored so we could visit the pre-arrange castle tour. The room was very comfortable, although we struggled to turn down the heating/operate the air con, that said we didn't ask for help so it was our own fault that we were a tad too warm. The ambiance in the room was nice but the option to turn up the lighting would have been good. The pre-arranged birthday petit fours were there and very nice too. We had breakfast on the two mornings, a bit of a let down was the Mal breakfast, sausage was not very nice and the fried egg wasn't either, the rest of it was fine and hot; we didn't complain though so not sure what sort of response we would have had; the second morning we had the smoked salmon and scrambled egg and I must say this was very good. We didn't eat there in the evening although we did have a few drinks in the cocktail and brasserie bars which enevitably were a bit pricey. Glad we went, a thoroughly enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Good for short weekend !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were really friendly and helpful. The food was excellent and very good value for money. The hotel was quite unique in design, being a converted prison, retaining many original features. Rooms ( we were in a standard room 125 ) quite small but beautifully decorated and everything was in there that you might need. The location was perfect for sightseeing and shopping.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel conversion from former prison

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though this hotel doesn't have family friendly rooms, our kids (and us!) really wanted to stay in a prison during the summer holiday. We booked two 'cell' rooms, which were opposite each other and had a fantastic stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic treat for anyone!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The place is totally unique and well worth the extra cost. The breakfast was included in our rate and was good, though the 'posh' sausages weren't liked by the kids. The on-site parking was great and well-worth pre-booking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place for a weekend retreat for a couple - not bad for families if you are happy paying for two rooms.
reviews.title: Pleasure to be locked-up at Her Majesty's Pleasure !!
Great location and renovation of an old prison
reviews.text: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Considering this used to be a prison they have done a good job decorating lol. The rooms are well decorated and of a decent size. Only issue I have with the room is that the TV is very dated, they could have updated the TV's. One thing I was pleasantly surprised about was that we had Sky Sports in our room! The surrounding area is pretty and you are literally in the centre of town. I'm not quite sure if it is worth the money but it's worth a shout if your in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel, transformed from the old Oxford Castle Jail (!!!), taking advantage of their Sunday night offer.
reviews.title: Porridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Impressive building but the beauty appeared to be predominantly skin deep.
reviews.title: Nice place to serve your time, but lacking in substance for the price tag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the "niggles" seem wholly related to the building's previous use and probably very tricky to overcome.
reviews.title: Curate's egg - has the designer (or manager) tried to read in the room after dark?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superior Rooms are a good size with lovely linen, towels and robes. The bed was large but hard for my liking with ridiculously floppy pillows. Light and noise comes through the door frame where the old cell door doesn't quite fit. It was only a few mm's but it makes a difference. In our room particularly there was a lot of noise from outside. Rooms are stuffy with ineffectual air con and no opening windows. Great shower and huge bathroom with roll top bath was a nice treat.
reviews.title: Gorgeous prison hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Cocktails in the bar were well made and hideously expensive
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Food in the brasserie was hideously expensive. The restaurant has a nice ambience but to be honest we should have gone to Pizza Express. Food here was significantly under expectation. Nice service from the waiting staff though.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but beds are reminder of previous usage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were kept awake by thumping music until 2am which ruined an otherwise pleasant stay. Staff no help whatsoever . At these prices you should be able to sleep then you want to . Hotel itself is stylish, a nice building very close to centre of town.
reviews.title: Noisy and poor customer service
Fabulous!
reviews.text: What a quirky hotel to stop in. The rooms are adequately sized, with loads of accessories, they think of everything one could possible wish for. The hotel is in an ideal location to the centre of Oxford. The cocktail bar amazing and the staff so attentive one could not ask for more. The even serve the most perfect mojito. Would recommend booking a car space should you be driving. Will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night in a Superior Cell room on a package which included a bottle of champagne, a 3 course meal (from a set menu) in the brassiere and breakfast the next morning.
reviews.title: Quirky hotel with quite a few issues...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is, as other reviews have said fantastic. Very well converted into a hotel, with a lot of charm and character. Location is also great, a few minutes walk into the city centre. The hotel is also surrounded by a number of restaurants and bars on a little complex. You do have to pay to park at the hotel but then it is a city centre hotel so to be expected.
reviews.title: Great character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room… we had paid extra for a superior double cell room which is 3 cells knocked into 1. The room looked good and the bathroom was very spacious. It was a novelty staying in an old cell. Lighting is a massive issue though… could hardly see what I was doing when I was getting ready for dinner in the evening and I’m not exaggerating! The mirrors are also badly positioned, the one above the desk is too high when you are sitting there trying to do hair/makeup and the only full length mirror in the room is impossible to stand in front of. The bed was rock hard and didn’t feel particularly good quality. We had a roll top bath which was lovely. Very disappointed with the shower… black mould on the outside of the shower screen. When I used it, the water didn’t drain away… I’d only been in it a few minutes when I had to turn it off because the water was about to spill out of the shower tray onto the tiled floor.
reviews.title: Could have been brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Loved this hotel, it's totally unique! Perfect location right in the heart of Oxford! Couldn't be a better location!
reviews.title: Book it!
Something a bit different
reviews.text: Not the cheapest choice but the cells are quirky and the quality of the rooms was great. Breakfast was expensive but also good quality. Be prepared and book your car in the car park ASAP as only got room for about 20 cars and otherwise you have to pay to park around the corner :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overal a great stay
reviews.title: Good enough but something is missing
Ideal base for City break
reviews.text: The corridor where all the cells lead from has the wow factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very comfortable and interesting
reviews.title: The 'good life' behind bars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: We stayed here for a two night short break in Oxford. Our main aim was a centrally located hotel, we certainly got that! A short walk from the shops, restaurants and bars, totally perfect in that sense. But honestly, that's about it!
reviews.title: AWFUL STANDARD ROOMS!! Be warned!!
Central location with great rooms
reviews.text: We didn't stay in the cell house, but the building opposite, we weren't bothered about that, as we didn't spend that much time at the hotel. The room itself though was tragic. Musty, tiny and hairy! The pillows on the bed (the ones for decoration) were covered in hair! As was the bathroom floor. Vile! The tea was not replenished the next day. There was a leak under the tap. The desk chair was broken. We had worlds smallest television. The blinds were a drain to open and close and sometimes wouldn't work. Oh and one of the most annoying things! The shower was in the bath, fair do's, but the glass to stop the spray from the shower was useless as the shower was placed over the middle of the bath and the spray would go all over the bathroom floor, it would literally soak the bath mat. Pretty dangerous for a slipping risk!!

reviews.title: Captive way to spend the night!
reviews.text: For the price we paid, not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Worth a visit of you're a wig maker, you'll find plenty of hair!)
reviews.title: Very Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Oh and the valet parking if you want to call it that was of a poor standard. We would wait over 15 minutes just to get our car.
reviews.title: Best cell in Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for our short honeymoon break. Overall, we were impressed. we booked it through secret escapes. on arrival, i mentioned that we were on honeymoon, and they upgraded us to the Half Moon suite for free. the staff were very helpful and polite. the room itself was good, had all the mod-cons (TV, Ipod dock, espresso coffee maker, dvd player etc). the bathroom was lovely - there was a large walk in shower with two shower heads. however, the water temp and pressure was very tempramental. there were complimentary toiletries - but not small silly ones - huge bottles, and they were really nice! we took these ones home with us!! the breakfast was 'ok' - first morning, service was excellent as we were down there early. second morning however was not so good. the food was nice, but i got the impression they were trying too hard! only downfall of the whole stay was car parking. we hadnt booked this, as we didnt realise we needed to. on arrival, we were told "we will see what we can do" and when we went outside, our car had gone. we assumed they had just "fitted us in" like they suggested. no mention of charging... on checking out, we were landed with a £50 bill (£25/day). we wouldnt have minded so much if they had told us this on checking in!! and wheb you are paying all that money to stay there per night!!
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third visit to this hotel, each time we had been impressed (see other reviews) and each time we have moved up to a higher speced room. This time we went for a duplex suite.
reviews.title: Lost its edge..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The web site says. "A slinky split level affair featuring beds of an epic scale, feature baths with monsoon shower and outdoor balcony overlooking the historic castle mound"
reviews.title: AMAZING night in the cells No Complaints whatsoever! Highly Recommended :-)
Great 2day break,"Restaurant a rip off"
reviews.text: We split level I cannot argue with, and yes the bed was there. But its the bathroom that was a real let down. The shower was far from ideal, monsoon it was not, in fact it was hardly a light drizzle. There was no pressure to speak of and therefore the luke warm water that was coming out, was cold by the time it meandered towards me. The same was for the bath as well, in fact if you tried to turn on a tap, the shower was even less monsoon like. Ontop of this the shower base was chipped and worn and one of the two sinks didnt drain at all well. These may seem like petty complaints, but if you cannot get clean before a night out, and in the morning, it really takes the edge of the stay, especially when we have to use someone elses shower (a friend in another room) to get ready in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We brought the shower to the attention of the staff, but the issue was still there in the morning. We brought it up again when we checked out ( I apologise to the check in staff in we smelt, but thats a lack of shower for you), but nothing was offered apart from an apology.
reviews.title: Fab building, interesting room, great food, customer service lacking at Reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent the weekend at this hotel with friends. It is the most unusual hotel in which we've stayed, having been imaginatively converted from Oxford jail.
reviews.title: Impressive
Porridge for breakfast
reviews.text: We were upgraded and stayed in a room in the Governor's house which was comfortably furnished. The bathroom was modern. Soft furnishings and toiletries were of good quality. Housekeeping throughout the hotel was good. Public areas are very atmospheric and we loved the Visitors Bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food at dinner was lovely and breakfast was one of the best we've had.
reviews.title: Yes yes yes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff were professional, friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Pretty, but useless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have two complaints - 1) why only provide double beds when most 4*+ hotels provide queens and, 2) the lighting in both bedroom and bathroom was poor, I had to sit on the floor in front of a long window in the bedroom to apply makeup!
reviews.title: Luxurious Lock-in...
If you enjoy sleeping on granite.......
reviews.text: We arrived at the advertised check in time of 3pm. We were then told our room would be ready in 10 mins. we returned an hour later and were told it would be ready shortly and to wait in the bar and the receptionist would be down within a few mins with our key. An hour later, nothing, another trip to reception and eventually, more than 2 hours after our arrival we got to the room. Which was dreadful. Tiny, unable to watch the tv from the bed without risking neck injury, no bath, freezing cold. If this was a really cheap budget hotel it would have been bearable, but as it advertises itself as being a chic boutique style hotel, coupled with the 2 hour wait, it was just not acceptable. Compained to reception, and assured the receptionist would speak to her manager and ring back, nothing. Eventually called again, got the manager who said they were fully booked and could do nothing. Then after me ranting on a bit longer, miraculously a very nice room was found for us. Dinner was ok but the mains do not come with any veg, all bought separately. The bed was absolutely rock hard as mentioned by another reviewer. However, the only positive, the breakfast was fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: First the positives which have been covered by other reviewers:
reviews.title: OK but bring a flashlight with you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • the Oxford location
reviews.title: Ideal location for visiting Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: • the converted prison thing
reviews.title: Unique Hotel with stunning surrounds but eat elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • the 'groovy' design thing
reviews.title: Stay over on a Sunday for £25..... brilliant offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped off on a Sunday night on the way back to Glasgow after a wonderful weekend at GoodWood. Great location within walking distance of the town centre and the the University area, where we were keen to visit the filming location for Morse (Lewis)! Have stayed at Malmaison Glasgow and Newcastle and recommended this one due to its quirkiness as a converted prison! Have to say we were made to feel welcome from the moment we arrived. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout. The hotel is quite amazing – great fun but stylish and rooms are lovely with everything you need. The restaurant was busy for a Sunday night and didn’t feel like a hotel restaurant. A good experience and we would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: A wonderful weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just spent two lovely days in the Malmaison Oxford. Great location, incredibly helpful staff and good value for money as we had the Dream deal. In addition to our lovely room not a cell, we had a delicious cocktail each and a scrummy two course meal.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: £145 for two with room, dinner and a cocktail each, we thought was great value for money.
reviews.title: a very good -yet expensive choice
Exceptional looking hotel let down by service this time
reviews.text: Thanks to all the helpful reception staff especially the new guy, who we think is Spanish!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is located very centraly and the building is very interesting(old castle/prison) with a big history behind it.The stuff was very helpful and polite,although we were a bit dissapointed by the fact that we had to wait until 3:00 for check in (in most hotels you can check in much earlier).
reviews.title: What a shame !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Enjoyed the company of good friends who identified the Malmaison Oxford as an unusual and fun setting for a 50th birthday celebration. Great company and a very agreeable banqueting arrangement in the hotel's private dining room.
reviews.title: Weird hotel, incredibly converted from a former HMP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel, though, really is a rag bag of good intentions that don't quite come off. First of all it's VERY difficult to locate, with the hotel telling me once we’d finally got there that they use two separate postcodes to plug into sat nav for locating the hotel in a very central part of Oxford (would have had more luck with a Ouija board). Either way it was a challenge and we found ourselves parking at the rear of the property, walking round to the front and wondering if we'd found the right place. It is NOT at all well marked/signposted/badged, making an early evening arrival in the dusk very tricky indeed. Once located, the Check-in was absolutely tedious, forced to sit in an armchair while a charmless check in clerk fired a dozen or so questions that served to irk rather than inspire - and the process certainly failed to engage as any kind of welcome. First 5 minutes? FAIL.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found our way through poorly sign posted corridors to annexe ('House of Correction'). Double room, prepaid in full £185, room only. And what a small and poorly lit room it proved to be, stuffed with unnecessary pieces of furniture that have the end result of allowing no wider than a 4ft 6in bed to occupy the room. Hotel reception advised that's the standard size throughout - pretty damned hopeless when you think that rooms are starting at nearly £200 and many are double that. One might also think that the rock hard, thin mattresses in use are a throwback to the original prison issue bedding that was in use until the mid 90’s. Bathroom adequate, usual Malmaison toiletries and a shower control knob that needed reattachment as it kept crashing into the bath.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hard to say whether or not the room (and rest of hotel) was squeaky clean - lighting so dim, it really was difficult to see even the buttons in the lift. Low lit throughout the hotel's public areas, there were trip hazards aplenty that left us treading very carefully.
reviews.title: A unique experience in a good central location,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of comments on service - the bar staff were very busy when we arrived en masse, but did a great job to make us welcome after an inevitable wait to be served (2 people doing cocktails etc to a bar of getting on for 100 at peak early evening crowd time). Their hard work was overshadowed by a bullying and frankly ineffectual 'Manager' who interfered with what his team were trying to achieve, before heading back to stare at the till screen adjacent to the bar, appearing confidently uninterested and disengaged from his choice of career in the hospitality business...a tip, the clue is in the name of your chosen profession. Banqueting staff did a great job getting 36 covers taken care of across three courses and in a very tight space. Non intrusive, efficient and very polite. The food was good, with a well-chosen wine combination,
reviews.title: Something a little different.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We took friends here to celebrate my 50th birthday and it is such an unusual hotel! The rooms are amazing, we had superior cells so we could enjoy the atmosphere of the old prison but still have the lovely roll top baths etc. Loved the setting with the courtyard, had drinks in the old visiting room bar, which is an experience just in itself. Very clean throughout, breakfast was great, very relaxed etc. Most staff were friendly, the occasional one wasn't so good, particularly on the phone.
reviews.title: Really unusual, rooms are amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this wonderful hotel whislt visitng the city with my partner,
reviews.title: Tremendous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not enough good things i can stay about this place, form the room, to the staff to the food and atmosphere, the whole place is awesome.
reviews.title: A prison you would want to revisit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best way for you to find out is to stay yourself, its not the cheapest but it is worth every penny.
reviews.title: Loved the building and the concept, but organisation and restaurant failed to deliver.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed cheap on a Sunday night because we ate in the restuarant, a real treat.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel, hard tobelieve it was ever a prison!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The good: An attractively decorated large room, with separate bedroom (I had an upgrade so am unsure what I would have gotten for the price originally paid). A 15 minute walk from the train station. Conveniently located to the attractions of Oxford.
reviews.title: Nice for a special occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The not so good: A long wait to check-in, with no acknowledgement from staff during the wait, or once served. Staff at the door and in the bar weren't very friendly. I saw very few people about - staff or visitors - making for a feeling of emptiness. Whilst this hotel is nice to look at, it doesn't feel inviting or envoke a sense of warmth/confort.
reviews.title: Atmospheric, excellent rooms
Great character, service lacking.
reviews.text: Recommendation: Stay here to celebrate a special occassion; otherwise, from other reviews I have read, I'm confident there is just as nice accomodation available in Oxford at a more reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clever conversion hotel. Tasteful rooms with better than normal bathroom and bath products. The lighting could have been brighter but other than that, a beautiful hotel. We did not eat in the hotel as there are many restaurants nearby. Easy walk to the town centre, colleges and shops.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with lots of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here with 2 friends for a Morse pub crawl weekend. The hotel is lovely and has lots of character in the old part, where we stayed. The rooms were fantastic and really quirky, but also very comfortable. However, the character comes at a cost. We paid £250 for a superior room on the Friday, and £280 on the Saturday.
reviews.title: Great wedding night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this hotel just before New Year 2012.. I was a little unsure how I would feel as it was a converted prison. We stayed in a side building for this reason. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised, it was well decorated and had a really peaceful atmosphere. Check in was quick and efficient, staff were pleasant throughout our stay. We looked at the converted cell area in the hotel, these actually looked really nice, may well try one of these next time and there will be one.
reviews.title: A fascinating place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast as it was far too expensive and visited a the Art Cafe a few minutes from hotel, it was Organic and they also catered for
reviews.title: Amazingly unique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customers requiring Gluten Free food, definitely recommend this. Overall the price for the stay was warranted but the parking was costly this being £25.00 for one night.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is based right in the centre of Oxford in what used to be the prison. The conversion is amazing given the previous use of the building. We booked a superior double room which was located in the new road block rather than a cell, which we would have preferred. That said, the room was amazing. Huge bed, roll top bath and huge bathroom and lots of extras. We didn't opt for breakfast as we thought it a bit pricey at £14. There are loads of caves and restaurants nearby. The dining room did look nice though. We did try a drink in the visitors room bar which was lovey and service was good. The only negative would be the check in/ out. It was rather slow and inefficient. We even traipsed too our room through the meandering corridors only to find the room key hasn't been programmed!! Other than this minor niggle I would return tomorrow. There is parking at the hotel for a substantial £25 but anyone who frequents will know that this is the going rate for city parking. We used one of the park and ride services which was really good.
reviews.title: Cell room 101 something romantic about the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a Sunday night in one of the cells, fabulous hotel, friendly staff, great for a romantic getaway. Restaurant was great with food cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: Good Not Great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Malmaison Oxford. Its location is central, the rooms are a good size with fantastic bathrooms (I stayed in a Deluxe room and had a walk-in monsoon shower and a roll-top bath and the breakfast included is great. It would be easy for this hotel to rest on its laurels given the great setting and features of an old prison but the service is fantastic and the place is spotless and really well looked after, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel stay in Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: An interesting twist on an old castle that is well placed in Oxford. Nicely redone with a bit of history attached to each room. You get to occupy a room which would have been the office of the administrator of the jail that the castle was before!
reviews.title: History with chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WE stayed one night at Malmaison Oxford in August 2012 for our wedding anniversary and receieved a free upgrade to a superior double at check in.
reviews.title: Fantastic theme hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service we recieved was impecible throughout with friendly reception and dining room staff.
reviews.title: Lots of character, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in a converted cell in the main prison block- i would suggest that if you were going to stay, you may as well pay the extra to stay in one of these special rooms as thats the whole novelty fator about the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds for a few drinks with a glitch
